intro: Lespedeza formosa f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered lespeadeza, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, fluffy white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its trifoliate leaves are alternate and have a delicate, feathery appearance. Lespedeza formosa f. albiflora is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
